channel.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
channel.description:
Well...I got everything set up, finally, but for some reason, i must have screwed up on port forwarding.
I own a Motorola WR850G, and i port forwarded via "Routing" section. Here's what i did; (i made 2) Protocol; TCD - WAN PORT START/END; 43594 - LAN IP ADDRESS; 192.168.10.5 (as said on gateway address) - LAN PORT START/END - 43594 Protocol; UDP - WAN PORT START/END; 43594 - LAN IP ADDRESS; 192.168.10.5 (as said on gateway address) - LAN PORT START/END - 43594
I can get on, but my friends/other players cannot. Also, the "error connecting to server..." shows up about 20 seconds after the player attempts to log in.
Any help would be very much appreciated!
>.Mike.< :)

item.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

You have to have protocal both, make sure your not blocking anonymous connections, and make a port in your fire wall 43594

Read full topic

item.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

So you setup static ip portforwarded and you’re sure you did no-ip correctly…you downloaded the DUC aswell?

Edit: Oh does your router have a DMZ zone?

Also download this to check if you forwarded correctly.
http://www.portforward.com/help/portcheck.htm

item.source: Other players can't connect to my server?

item.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

Maybe you have a firewall up or something?

On my router i have to do two things…I have to portforward of course and i have to uncheck a box that blocks anonymous requests.
Maybe yours is similar…Look around on your router for something of the sort.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 08, 2009, 08:29:08 pm[/size][hr]Edit: I just looked up your router. You need a static ip did you set one up?

Read full topic

item.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
item.dc:creator: @gelert gelert
item.description:
@gelert wrote:

he/ she may not be using the right adress
click
start/run type cmd and then a black box should pop up
click on it and type ipconfig
you should somthing like this

ip adress... 129.168.blank.blank

item.title: Other players can't connect to my server?
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

Did you do the no-ip step? and when you type ipconfig/all in command prompt you didn’t use the Default gateway address correct? You used the Lan address it gives you thats next to just ip Address?

And @gelert that probably wouldn’t really make a difference considering he made two UDP and TCP

Edit: This will probably get moved or some ass will say that we don’t help with portforwarding. which is ridiculous IMO

Read full topic

item.description:
@r0fl_0wn3d wrote:

Well…I got everything set up, finally, but for some reason, i must have screwed up on port forwarding.

I own a Motorola WR850G, and i port forwarded via “Routing” section. Here’s what i did;
(i made 2)
Protocol; TCD - WAN PORT START/END; 43594 - LAN IP ADDRESS; 192.168.10.5 (as said on gateway address) - LAN PORT START/END - 43594
Protocol; UDP - WAN PORT START/END; 43594 - LAN IP ADDRESS; 192.168.10.5 (as said on gateway address) - LAN PORT START/END - 43594

I can get on, but my friends/other players cannot. Also, the “error connecting to server…” shows up about 20 seconds after the player attempts to log in.

Any help would be very much appreciated!

.Mike.<
